creator: glenmazza@yahoo.com
text:
Sun's JDK was renamed to the J2SE SDK some time ago 
(http://servlet.java.sun.com/help/download#113, FAQ #7, part 2)--this updates 
the Running.txt file to specify that the J2SE SDK, and not the "JDK", needs to 
be downloaded.  (Reduces confusion over whether the SDK or just the JRE need be 
downloaded.)

creator: glenmazza@yahoo.com
text:
Created attachment 8248
patch to running.txt (in root directory of jakarta-tomcat-4.0)

creator: yannc76@yahoo.de
text: *** Bug 23071 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: yannc76@yahoo.de
text: *** Bug 21867 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: glenmazza@yahoo.com
text:
I looked at the duplicated bugs and agree with them--we should also clearly 
state that the JRE alone is not sufficient and give a short explanation why.  
I've updated my patch to do that.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
Fixed in CVS for TC4 and TC5. Thanks for providing the patch. I changed the 
wording slightly to indicate that if you really know what you are doing the 
JRE is OK but otherwise stick to the SDK.
